              Jiale Guo

            About Me
            Hi! I am Jiale Guo, a Research Assistant(ra) at the
            Northwest Institute of Eco-Environment and Resources,
            Chinese Academy of Sciences (NIEER, CAS
            www.nieer.cas.cn).
            My research interests are very broad and include both
            Geospatial artificial intelligence (Geo-AI), X-AI,
            GIScience, Geospatial statistics and Geospatial-temporal
            analysis, as well as Hydrometeorology, Flash Drought, Snow
            Drought, hydrological model et.al.You might be wondering why
            I have such diverse research interests. It is well known
            that until the 1960s, much of the study done by geographers
            was qualitative in nature, necessitating a clear
            differentiation between one being a physical geographer and
            the other. However, the metrological geography revolution
            occurred, allowing geography to be studied scientifically
            and numerically despite its descriptive legacy. According to
            me, the age of the explosion of big data in geography has
            begun as a result of the ongoing development of earth
            observation technology.
            There is now both a wealth of quantitative analysis
            tools and a vast amount of geographical data available as
            input to geographic research. I do not confine myself to
            physical geography, human geography, or geoinformatics
            because of this; instead, I concentrate more on the
            methodological components of geography. Combining geographic
            approaches and data-driven solutions to contemporary
            geospatial difficulties is a particularly intriguing topic
            since spatial position variables are a crucial component of
            all sorts of geographic data. This is why I prefer the term
            “spatial data scientist” to be used.
            So, you can call me a spatial data scientist.
            
            
            Education
            Bachelor of Science, Geographical Science, |
            Chuzhou University, China 2017-2021
            Specialization: Land Management
            
            
            Honors
            Graduates with excellent academic performance in
            colleges and universities in Anhui Province, (1/57) Jun
            2021
            National Encouragement scholarship, Education Department
            of Anhui Province, (1/57) Oct 2020
            Academic Excellence Scholarship (First-class) of Chuzhou
            University, (1/57) Oct 2020
            Academic Excellence Scholarship (Third-class)) of
            Chuzhou University, (8/57) Oct 2019
            Academic Excellence Scholarship (Third-class) of Chuzhou
            University, (3/57) Oct 2018
            Excellent Student Leader of Chuzhou University, three
            times in 2018&2019&2020
            Award ¥5000 grant of “Internet +” University Student
            Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition Oct 2020
            
            
            Experience
            Google Brain | Principal Investigator |
            January 2018 - Present
            Netflix | Research Scientist | June 2014
            - December 2017
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Jiale Guo

              geographers was qualitative in nature, necessitating a
              clear differentiation between one being a physical

              crucial component of all sorts of geographic data. This is

              used.
              So, you can call me a spatial data scientist.
